programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Explore your inner child and let them out during playtime on this episode of Fresh Quilting. Steph Skardal encourages playing with color starting with paper before even adding fabric. Then, Catherine Cureton plays around with a mini quilt to turn it into a functional pillow. Eliane Bergmann has a machine tip on presser feet - when do you raise and when do you lower â€“ what is that knob on your machine?

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.sub-title: Bonus: How to Cut T-Shirts for a Quilt
programme.desc: Angela shares her top three tips on how to cut t-shirts for a quilt.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela's back and bursting with love. In this season premiere, she uses half-square triangles to make a modern bursting star quilt while sharing her tips on how to keep a lasting relationship with a quilter.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Are you Quilt Curious, but unsure where to get started? THIS is the Midnight Quilt Show episode for you!

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Today's show looks at a few classic details. Amy Alan has a serger lesson. She reviews the basic serger stitches and teaches when to use them and tension adjustments for each. Then, Angela Wolf introduces princess seams -- why you use them, how to adjust for fit, and then how to sew them. Finally, Kenneth D. King has a couture technique for curved tucks on a fabulous top.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: A classic style sometimes can use a change whether for fashion or fit. Fit expert Kathleen Cheetham teaches how to create a back yoke on a blouse to eliminate multiple darts or change to a more casual look. Then, it's a lesson on sleeves for your Little Black Dress with Angela Wolf. Finally, Gretchen Hirsch alters a favorite pattern by adding a flounce for a fashion flare.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: Tie it all together with a color drop necklace with tied ribbon, a loomed mosaic bracelet using tile beads with Julianna Hudgins and a recycled tie, cuff bracelet featuring crystal with Laura Timmons.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: Using parachute cord in a whole new way, author Ashley Bunting adds beads from her stash to make a charming, colorful floral brooch. Katie rides the floral jewelry wave with pendants made with leather flowers, wire and crystals.

programme.title: Scrapbook Soup
programme.desc: Add new life to the simplest designs. Ashley Horton adds splashes of color to highlight a page. Julie Fei-Fan Balzer explores the meaning of color with stamp rollers and watercolors. Ashley Horton has a tip for hand-stitching on scrapbook pages. Calligrapher Joanne Fink mixes it up with metallic inks.

programme.title: Make It Artsy
programme.desc: It's time to make it artsy. Knowing when to stop is as important as starting. There are subtle cues to help you decide when your project is complete. First, we begin with white space. Host Julie Fei Fan Balzer shows you don't have to fill in the whole page when you're stenciling. You can train your eye to leave just the right amount of space. Then it's a faux encaustic technique with Seth Apter. You'll learn when to stop and when to keep going. Finally, Mary Hettmansperger shares design techniques for fabric and fiber.

programme.title: Cast On/Bind Off
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Knit-Along: Socks
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: CAUTION: Baby quilts are a total gateway drug! Just ask Angela: she's working this cute little number up for her newborn nephew. (Think you can stop at one? Don't say we didn't warn you!)

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: All quilters can get stuck in a creative rut, even Angela. This week, she turns to strip piecing and her fun, easy-to-piece chevron pattern to get her quilting mojo back. Plus, she'll show you how to use negative space to bring your quilt to life.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Mistakes happen, even for the Midnight Quilter. But hey, the show must go on! Tune in to see how Angela conquers a little stitch snafu on her way to sewing a scrappy square-in-square stunner, just in time for her family reunion.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: In this season finale, Angela does a little flower arranging (quilter's style!) to create Monique Jacobs' beautiful Bouquet quilt.

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Craft Hacks
programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Sewing experts offer easy ways to create neat sewing projects right at home. Viewers of all skill levels learn tips and techniques for creating professional-looking garments, personalized apparel and home accents. Weekly episodes feature various themes, and feature two main projects and one shorter technique segment. Some projects include monogramming napkins and towels; baby poncho, hooded towel and baby-friendly diapers; embellishing yoga pants with a clothing tattoo; and sewing on knits.

programme.title: Slow TV
programme.desc: Take it slow with this model railroad tour.

programme.title: Slow TV
programme.desc: Take it slow with this model railroad tour.

programme.title: Creative Cake Design presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: Tap into your inner artist to create a stunning floral cake using Rachael Teufel's tips for textured floral cake accents. With careful palette knife techniques, Rachael demonstrates how to achieve beautiful details for an artistic, abstract design. Plus, she shares a few tricks for fixing mistakes and shows you how to create stunning wire flowers.

programme.title: Cook Once, Eat Twice
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Garden Party
programme.desc: Ready to dig in and grow your green thumb? Join us for a delightful hour of expert-led gardening tutorials designed to inspire and educate gardeners of all levels. From essential planting tips and soil secrets to creative container gardening and vibrant floral arrangements, our seasoned instructors will guide you through every step. Whether you're a seasoned horticulturist or just starting out, you'll find fresh ideas and practical techniques to cultivate the garden of your dreams.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Whether indoors or out, games are fun! Bowl at home with family and friends with a colorful bowling set Katie makes from recycled water bottles. Franz shows how to create your own game board using a variety of art mediums. Jenny and Katie make an indoor hopscotch court that rolls-up, for easy storage. Braid a ring toss toy then use the Family Craft box to make a treasure hunt jar for quiet fun.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: One of the keys of impressionism is the blending together of images. The definition of this movement in art is characterized by visible brush strokes, ordinary subject matters, and an emphasis on light and its changing qualities. The first project is an impressionistic landscape using oil pastels and black mat board. Then we're using dye in spray bottles to make colorful geometric designs. Learn about color blending using special tools to create interesting effects in your art journal. And finally, blend colored glue to create a piece of art.

programme.title: Photography
programme.desc: Learn photography with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Vanilla & Beyond: Baking With Flavors First
programme.desc: Learn to bake with CraftsyTV

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: This week's woven lattice quilt might look intricate, but it's actually perfect for beginners!

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: The thing about quilting is there's always room to grow, even for the midnight quilter! This episode's all about reflecting on personal growth. Well, that and how to put a modern spin on a traditional block we all know and love.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: The holidays are coming, but don't stress! We teamed up with Angela Walters, host of the Midnight Quilt Show, to create three DIY quilt projects that are super gift-able. In this episode, you'll learn how to make a cathedral window pillow, an adorable gift for someone in your life who you've deemed "quilt-worthy." - P.S. Don't miss Angela's tips for non-quilters on what to do (and what NOT to do!) when you receive a gift from a quilter...

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Do you experience stash-guilt? Well, Angela's got the cure with this scrappy stash-busting pattern.

programme.title: Craft Hacks
programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Pay attention to the details that make your garments more interesting and unique. Even the simplest blouse becomes memorable with a bow cuff shown by Lindsey Marsh. And a simple top is transformed into a fashion statement by snaps and zippers with Emily Thompson. Finally meet Gretchen Hirsch in the designer spotlight and how her love of vintage clothing became her career.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: We expand our view of classics by adding surface embellishments to personalize your garment. Cindy Hogan makes appliques from embroidery to add detail to any garment. Then, it's our next lesson in the Little Black Dress from Angela Wolf and different seam finishes including the Hong Kong. Last is embroidery expert Eileen Roche and easy dress embroidery for beautiful style.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.desc: Do you squish and sniff before you buy? Are you infamous for knitting in cars, buses, even at funerals? This week the girls discuss all the things that only knitters understand.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.desc: It's here. You know, the "F" word. (No no, not that one!) And we're not going to let that pesky little word stand in the way of completing the Sweet Summer Knit-Along. Nope. We're grabbing finishing by the needles, and ending that sweater on a high note, and celebrating, naturally.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: With friends and family, create and wear your crafting projects. A fashionable, shimmery clay bird necklace is perfect to wear or to give as a gift. Franz shows how to draw original designs and transfer them to your t-shirt. Jenny uses plastic tableware and fabric dye to make a stenciled flower or flag on a t-shirt. Katie weaves a colorful loop bracelet you can make in your favorite colors or school colors. Use the Family Craft box to transform a t-shirt into a superhero cape with a custom-designed logo.

programme.title: Photography
programme.desc: Learn photography with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Creative Cake Design presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: Find inspiration from ornate Spanish tiles and bring them to life on your next cake with Rachael Teufel's step-by-step guidance. From applying buttercream and fondant to pressing and decorating your tiles, Rachael show you how to create a showstopping cake that's as beautiful as the streets of Barcelona.

programme.title: Woodworkers Guild of America presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: Whether it holds recipes, keepsakes, sewing tools, or anything else, this handmade box makes a perfect last minute gift for any occasion. George Vondriska shows you how to whip up your own handmade box in just a few simple steps.

programme.title: Woodworkers Guild of America presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: The simple wooden spatula is an essential cooking tool that adds a handmade touch to any kitchen. George Vondriska demonstrates how to make your own wooden spatula in a few easy steps. This easy project makes a great gift for any home chef.

programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Explore design from a fresh perspective. Free-motion quilt artist Christina Cameli echo quilts and contrasts curves and lines to create new designs. Art historian and quilter Allison Evans joins modern quilt activist Heather Grant to discuss charity quilting events. Quilt innovator Jacquie Gering quilts with gentle curves.
